intro: Grammosciadium macrodon subsp. cornutum, commonly known as the horned grammosciadium, is a perennial herb native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, inflated seed pods that resemble horns, giving it its common name. The plant typically grows in grassy areas and along riverbanks, thriving in well-drained soils. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often covered in fine hairs, while the flowers are small and clustered in whorls. The species is notable for its unique morphology and ecological role in its native habitat.
